net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.layout

Class Layout

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.layout.Layout

  • public class Layout
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class for layouts. A layout defines using a grid (aka table) how the various components of a Window (aka HTML page) should look. The methods in this class are NOT thread safe. If you must access from concurrent threads, you must handle synchronization.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Describes a cell in a Layout.

      • elementAfterX

        public Layout.GridEntry elementAfterX(int x,
                                      int y)
        Get the GridEntry that occupies the next available column to the right of the given cell in the same column. If a cell spans into the row it will be returned.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cell.
        y - The Y coordinate of the cell.
        Returns:
        GridEntry or null.

      • elementAfterY

        public Layout.GridEntry elementAfterY(int x,
                                      int y)
        Get the GridEntry that occupies the next available row below the given cell in the same column. If a cell spans into the column it will be returned.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cell.
        y - The Y coordinate of the cell.
        Returns:
        GridEntry or null.

        Parameters:

        y - The y coordinate.
        Returns:

        Fix the constraint gridx value in the given row to be correct according to how it exists in the row.
        Parameters:

        Returns the number of columns less any empty columns at the beginning or end.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero.

        Returns:

      • getColumnSpan

        public int getColumnSpan(int x,
                         int y,
                         boolean limitToUsedColumns)
        Get the column span for the given cell. The cell must start the column span or the result will be 1.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the cell
        y - The y position of the cell
        limitToUsedColumns - If true, the column span will go beyond the last used column
        Returns:
        The number of columns the cell spans

      • getColumnWeight

        public float[] getColumnWeight(int firstColumn,
                               int lastColumn)
        Gets the maximum weightx value in each column from the constraints. Normalizes to the interval [0,1]. The sum of the values in the result will equal one except when all weights are zero, in which case the same will equal zero.
        Parameters:
        firstColumn - The first column to include in the result
        lastColumn - The last column to include in the result
        Returns:
        A float[] of normalized weights

      • getConstraint

        public LayoutConstraint getConstraint(Component com)
        Get the constraint for the component.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        Returns:
        LayoutConstraint or null if the component is not in the layout.

                     int y,
                     Component com)
        Set a component to a specific grid location.
        Parameters:

        y - The y coordinate.
        com - The component.
        Returns:

      • set

        @Nullable
public Component set(int x,
                               int y,
                               Component com,
                               @Nullable
                               LayoutConstraint con)
        Set a component to a specific grid location. The constraint gridx and gridy properties are modified for the x and y arguments.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.
        com - The component.
        con - The constraint.
        Returns:
        The previous component in the cell or null.

        Set the border size.
        Parameters:
        x - The border size.

      • setSpecificLayout

        public void setSpecificLayout(boolean sl)
        Set whether a specific layout was specified. This is normally automatically determined, but can be manually set for special cases.
        Parameters:
        sl - the specific layout value

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of components in this Layout.
        Returns:
        The number of components.
